snippet: Even as communities in New Jersey clamor for sand, scientists warn that rising seas will make maintaining artificial beaches too expensive or simply impossible.
abstract: News analysis; debate over costs and methods of maintaining New Jersey's community beaches has arisen in wake of destruction wrought by Hurricane Sandy; some advocate artificial maintenance of beaches by bringing in sand from offshore, while opponents say that rising seas will make beach maintenance prohibitively expensive or impossible.
lead_paragraph: Even as communities in New Jersey clamor for sand, scientists warn that rising seas will make maintaining artificial beaches too expensive or simply impossible.

headline.seo: Storm Raises Costs of Shoring Up Coastal Communities
headline.main: Costs of Shoring Up Coastal Communities
headline.print_headline: Costs of Shoring Up Coastal Communities
